title: Global Cooperation in a Time of Geopolitical Disruption
content: With the rules-based international order breaking down, “minilateralism” might offer a means of devising new ideas – in particular, for scalable interventions that tangibly improve people’s lives. Without interventions that highlight the benefits of international engagement, broad-based cooperation will remain a hard sell.
creator: Saliem Fakir
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Quantum Computing Could Fix AI’s Sustainability Problem
content: As generative AI pushes power grids to their limits, the industry largely favors incremental measures that fail to address underlying issues. The path toward sustainable AI lies in combining quantum computing with energy-efficient application design.
creator: Bertrand Badré
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: MAGA’s Approach to Europe Hasn’t Changed
content: Although the speech that US Secretary of State Marco Rubio delivered to this year’s Munich Security Conference was softer in tone than the one that Vice President JD Vance gave last year, the Europe he celebrated was that of the ethno-nationalist far right. Europe is on its own, and it must start acting like it.
creator: Mark Leonard
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: The Global Green Financial Divide Is Growing
content: By repealing the "endangerment finding" that required US authorities to consider the societal costs of greenhouse-gas emissions, the Trump administration has further reduced the regulatory burden on US banks relative to their peers. For advocates of international competition on a level playing field, it is an unwelcome change.
creator: Howard Davies
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Superpower Europe
content: Europe may be a different kind of superpower, given the extent to which it prioritizes values, rules, and multilateralism over sheer might. But it is a superpower nonetheless, and it is increasingly pursuing investments and reforms that will make it not only unassailable but also widely attractive in a dangerous world.
creator: Nadia Calviño
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: The EU Cannot Afford to Bluff on Ukrainian Membership
content: Europe’s debate over the process of making Ukraine a full member is often framed as a test of resolve; but credibility is based as much on capacity as on intent. If promises cannot be sustained politically, they will eventually be broken, and the fallout will be strategically damaging.
creator: László Bruszt
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Turkey’s Lawfare Is a Warning
content: The detention of Istanbul Mayor Ekrem İmamoğlu in Turkey is a classic example of democratic backsliding. Using legal institutions and procedures to shape who can run, who can speak, and who can organize has become the preferred method for limiting political competition while retaining the veneer of democracy.
creator: Bilal Bilici
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Five US Policy Shifts Could Reshape Financial Markets
content: US President Donald Trump’s administration is advancing a series of domestic policy changes that affect credit, housing, monetary policy, corporate governance, and digital-asset markets. Taken together, they could transform the regulatory landscape and reverberate through the global economy.
creator: Dambisa Moyo
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Europe Is Squandering Its Leverage Over China
content: Requiring Chinese companies that want to sell high-tech products in Europe to form joint ventures with local firms would go a long way toward strengthening the competitiveness of European industry. With its market having become a lifeline for China, the EU needs to recognize the strength of its bargaining position.
creator: Dalia Marin
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: AI Will Transform Business, Not Just Jobs
content: Debates about the impact of AI have centered on potential job losses, with far less attention paid to its implications for the business landscape. But corporate leaders should be thinking about how the technology can enhance their organizational capabilities and, in turn, increase economy-wide productivity.
creator: Diane Coyle
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Hope and Disappointment in India
content: India’s promise is undeniable, yet political dysfunction and empty rhetoric continue to undermine its long-term prospects. The absence of reliable statistics, lagging innovation, and worsening air quality all point to institutional decay that only sustained, coordinated national action can reverse.
creator: Kaushik Basu
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Financing the Global South’s Infrastructure Boom
content: Across the Global South, one of the biggest challenges is not just to build more infrastructure, but to build it right. Without institutional capacity and financial depth, the increasingly popular public-private-partnership model can backfire, creating a vicious spiral of debt, delays, and disillusionment.
creator: Rakesh Mohan
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Thailand’s Royalist Right Turn
content: With a rock-solid parliamentary majority, as well as the backing of the military and judiciary, the royalist-conservative Bhumjaithai Party is poised to spend its full four-year term governing in the service of establishment interests. But that does not mean it will all be smooth sailing ahead.
creator: Thitinan Pongsudhirak
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Redrawing the Map of American Prosperity
content: In a country as large and diverse as the United States, expanding economic opportunity cannot and should not depend on volatile federal policies. A framework of directed improvisation that aligns federal and state priorities with local capacities offers a promising way to promote broad-based development.
creator: Joseph Parilla
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Conflicting Policies, Confused Investors, and the Weak Dollar
content: The United States’ unique economic advantages – deep financial markets, a strong institutional framework, and the world's dominant reserve currency – should not be mistaken for invincibility. In fact, markets are already pricing US policy uncertainty the same way they price that of countries that do not have a reserve currency.
creator: Şebnem   Kalemli-Özcan
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: The New Global Order
content: As the post-Cold War era recedes, a more regional and competitive order is reasserting itself. Under these conditions, it is not surprising that larger powers would seek to shape their immediate surroundings – not only out of ambition, but also because they face constraints farther afield.
creator: Nancy Qian
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Will Capping Credit-Card Interest Rates Help Ordinary Americans?
content: The federal cap on credit-card interest rates that US President Donald Trump has proposed would, in theory, prevent issuers from gouging customers. But not everyone agrees that this would be good for Americans, especially lower-income households that are often the most desperate for credit.
creator: Jeffrey Frankel
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Those Who Most Need to Understand AI Don’t Get It
content: While anyone familiar with past technological hype cycles can see that today’s predominantly young technologists are overly optimistic about AI’s potential benefits, mainstream economists seem to suffer from tunnel vision of a different sort. If recent history is any guide, that should worry us all.
creator: Charles Ferguson
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: India’s Game-Changing Digital Money Model
content: Over the past decade, India has built the world’s largest real-time payments system. By using public infrastructure to expand financial inclusion, it offers a model for other developing countries that want to modernize payments without being dependent on a few multinational corporations.
creator: Rishi Suri
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Why MAGA Fears Europe
content: US President Donald Trump and his acolytes have long promoted the narrative that the European Union is weak and misguided, and there was no let-up at the World Economic Forum’s annual gathering Davos in January or at this month’s Munich Security Conference. But the truth is that Europe’s social-market model and commitment to openness continue to pay dividends. Far from doubting itself, the EU should double down on its strengths and, as the US-China geopolitical rivalry heats up, tout them as an example for the rest of the world.
creator: PS Commentators
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: The Big Picture
content: <html><head></head><body></body></html>
creator: PS editors
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Venezuelan Democracy Needs Action, Not Cheap Talk
content: US President Donald Trump’s Venezuela strategy prioritizes oil reconstruction over elections, treating democracy as an afterthought. But without credible institutions and political legitimacy, Venezuela cannot attract the private capital needed to rebuild its oil sector or provide the legal certainty long-term projects demand.
creator: Ricardo Hausmann
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: A New Iranian Revolution?
content: Amid deepening economic crisis, rising popular discontent, and mounting US pressure, the odds appear to be stacked against the Islamic Republic. Unless Iran's ruling regime embraces a more moderate approach, it may soon face collapse, with destabilizing effects on the entire region.
creator: Shlomo Ben-Ami
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Marco Rubio’s Sugar-Coated MAGA
content: While US Vice President JD Vance used his remarks to the Munich Security Conference last year to hector and insult European leaders, Secretary of State Marco Rubio seemed more eager to flatter. And yet, America’s top diplomat merely confirmed that the transatlantic divide has become massive – and is still widening.
creator: Carl Bildt
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page
